text: Ernest Charles "Chuck" Arnason (born July 15, 1951 in Ashern, Manitoba) is a Canadian retired professional ice hockey right wing who played 401 games over 8 seasons in the National Hockey League for the Montreal Canadiens, Atlanta Flames, Pittsburgh Penguins, Kansas City Scouts, Cleveland Barons, Colorado Rockies, Minnesota North Stars and Washington Capitals. He is the father of ice hockey player Tyler Arnason. ==Awards and achievements== *MJHL Goal Scoring Leader (1969) *WCHL Scoring Champion (1971) *WCHL Goals Leader (1971) *WCHL All-Star First Team (1971) *“Honoured Member” of the Manitoba Hockey Hall of Fame ==References== * * Profile at hockeydraftcentral.com Category:1951 births Category:Atlanta Flames players Category:Canadian ice hockey right wingers Category:Cleveland Barons (NHL) players Category:Colorado Rockies (NHL) players Category:Flin Flon Bombers players Category:Ice hockey people from Manitoba Category:Kansas City Scouts players Category:Living people Category:Minnesota North Stars players Category:Montreal Canadiens players Category:Pittsburgh Penguins players Category:Washington Capitals players
